abstract: Israeli Ministry of Culture and Sport says it will require performers at government-sponsored music events to dress modestly, reflecting rise of Conservative Judaism and reversing burkini debate sweeping Europe; announcement follows incident in which singer Hanna Goor was removed from Tel Aviv stage for wearing bikini top under unbuttoned shirt.

headline.print_headline: Entering Bikini Fray, Israel Orders Concert Singer to Cover Up
headline.main: Israel Joins Bikini Fray, Ordering Concert Singer to Cover Up

snippet: In a twist on the French debate over the full-body burkini worn by some Muslim women, Israel is insisting on modest dress by performers at government-sponsored events....
lead_paragraph: In a twist on the French debate over the full-body burkini worn by some Muslim women, Israel is insisting on modest dress by performers at government-sponsored events.
